sense.name: embark, hazard, put at risk
sense.examples: So the little penguin ventured out on her own and waddled as far as she could. In 1997, Albus Dumbledore and Harry Potter ventured to the seaside cave where Voldemort had hidden his locket. The truth of the story I mean you shall hear, how she ventured her life for the sake of her dear. She ventured a shy glance of timid admiration.

sense.name: put forward, guess
sense.examples: 'They're probably predominantly Shiite,' he ventured. He ventured that the possible source might be a radical, hightech, breakaway band of Indians.
